subject: Sleep
title: What Is the Circadian Rhythm
description: A 1-minute de-risking session on What Is the Circadian Rhythm.

hook.text: Put a person in a cave with no clocks, no sunlight, no phone. They still sleep on roughly a 24-hour cycle.

buildup.text: In the 1960s, a French scientist lived underground for months. His body kept a near-daily rhythm.

discovery.text: The circadian rhythm is an internal clock running in almost every cell of your body.

twist.text: It's not exactly 24 hours. Most people run slightly longer, which is why sunlight resets it daily.

climax.text: This clock controls not just sleep but hunger, hormones, body temperature, and immune function.

punchline.text: You carry a clock in every cell you own.

quiz.question: What happens without external time cues?
options: People sleep randomly with no pattern
The body maintains a roughly 24-hour cycle
